snippet: Terrorists won’t bring down Western civilization, and the tradeoffs we make to counter it should not include giving in to the panic they hope to create.
abstract: Paul Krugman Op-Ed column argues worst damage jihadists can inflict on West is not through death or destruction, but by sowing pervasive, debilitating fear; claims response to Paris attacks should chart middle course between appeasement that emboldens terrorist  and aggression that can empower them.
lead_paragraph: Terrorists won’t bring down Western civilization, and the tradeoffs we make to counter it should not include giving in to the panic they hope to create.
